com.eemi.ext4j.client.ui

Class Button

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
        • com.eemi.ext4j.client.core.AbstractComponent

            • com.eemi.ext4j.client.ui.Button
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observable, com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.HasAttachHandlers, com.google.gwt.event.shared.HasHandlers, com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasVisibility, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IsWidget
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SplitButton, Tab

    public class Button
extends Component
    A simple class to display different styles of buttons.

        public com.google.gwt.user.client.Element getButtonElement()

      • setTemplate

        public void setTemplate(Template template)
        A Template with which to create the Button's main element. This Template must contain numeric substitution parameter 0 if it is to display the text property. Changing the template could require code modifications if required elements (e.g. a button) aren't present. The defaut tempalte is 
         
 
 <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="x-btn-wrap"><tbody><tr>
   <td class="x-btn-left"><i> </i></td><td class="x-btn-center"><em unselectable="on"><button class="x-btn-text" type="{1}">{0}</button></em></td><td class="x-btn-right"><i> </i></td>
 </tr></tbody></table>
        Parameters:
        template - the button template

      • setDestroyMenu

        public void setDestroyMenu(boolean value)

      • setShowEmptyMenu

        public void setShowEmptyMenu(boolean value)
        True to force an attached menu with no items to be shown when clicking this button. By default, the menu will not show if it is empty.

        Defaults to: false

        Parameters:
        value -

      • setShrinkWrap

        public void setShrinkWrap(boolean value)
        If this property is a number, it is interpreted as follows: 0: Neither width nor height depend on content. This is equivalent to false. 1: Width depends on content (shrink wraps), but height does not. 2: Height depends on content (shrink wraps), but width does not. The default. 3: Both width and height depend on content (shrink wrap). This is equivalent to true. In CSS terms, shrink-wrap width is analogous to an inline-block element as opposed to a block-level element. Some container layouts always shrink-wrap their children, effectively ignoring this property (e.g., Ext.layout.container.HBox, Ext.layout.container.VBox, Ext.layout.component.Dock). Defaults to: 3
        Parameters:
        value -

      • setShrinkWrap

        public void setShrinkWrap(java.lang.Double value)
        If this property is a number, it is interpreted as follows: 0: Neither width nor height depend on content. This is equivalent to false. 1: Width depends on content (shrink wraps), but height does not. 2: Height depends on content (shrink wraps), but width does not. The default. 3: Both width and height depend on content (shrink wrap). This is equivalent to true. In CSS terms, shrink-wrap width is analogous to an inline-block element as opposed to a block-level element. Some container layouts always shrink-wrap their children, effectively ignoring this property (e.g., Ext.layout.container.HBox, Ext.layout.container.VBox, Ext.layout.component.Dock). Defaults to: 3
        Parameters:
        value -

      • setGlyph

        public void setGlyph(java.lang.String value)
        A numeric unicode character code to use as the icon for this button. The default font-family for glyphs can be set globally using Ext.setGlyphFontFamily(). Alternatively, this config option accepts a string with the charCode and font-family separated by the @ symbol. For example '65@My Font Family'.

      • setGlyph

        public void setGlyph(java.lang.Double value)
        A numeric unicode character code to use as the icon for this button. The default font-family for glyphs can be set globally using Ext.setGlyphFontFamily(). Alternatively, this config option accepts a string with the charCode and font-family separated by the @ symbol. For example '65@My Font Family'.

      • setClickEvent

        public void setClickEvent(java.lang.String value)
        The DOM event that will fire the handler of the button. This can be any valid event name (dblclick, contextmenu). Defaults to: "click"
        Parameters:
        value - , the value of the clickEvent value

      • setFocusCls

        public void setFocusCls(java.lang.String value)
        The CSS class to add to a button when it is in the focussed state. Defaults to: "focus"
        Parameters:
        value - , the value of the focusCls value

      • setHref

        public void setHref(java.lang.String value)
        The URL to open when the button is clicked. Specifying this config causes the Button to be rendered with an anchor (An element) as its active element, referencing the specified URL. This is better than specifying a click handler of
        Window.Location.assign("http:://www.nttdata.com");
        because the UI will provide meaningful hints to the user as to what to expect upon clicking the button, and will also allow the user to open in a new tab or window, bookmark or drag the URL, or directly save the URL stream to disk. setHrefTarget
        Parameters:
        value - , the value of the href value

      • setHrefTarget

        public void setHrefTarget(java.lang.String value)
        The target attribute to use for the underlying anchor. Only used if the href property is specified. Defaults to: "_blank"
        Parameters:
        value - , the value of the hrefTarget value

      • setScale

        Parameters:
        value -
